_o-hO1PRhQ2PLVUdu7Mieg.text: Absolutely terrible! i wish i could give zero stars. I certainly will never go back. I was there with my sister and my son. I first ordered the sushi which was ok and for our meals i ordered the chicken and scallops and my sister did the steak and scallops. When our food arrived it was drenched in what looked like dirty water they call their sauce. We told the waiter and he did nothing about it. We didnt even touch our meals it was terrible. We then paid and a manager then showed up. our checks both 50 dollars which we ate maybe 10 dollars worth was ridiculous. The manager came up to us with 10 dollar gift cards for each of us. Wow my meal was 27 alone and you think 10 dollars was enough. I had to leave that place and go find dinner somewhere else. I will never go back. If you like dirty water sauce and not fresh seafood then by all means enjoy but for me Nakama is the best of the best!!!

T1oLaW2pmuOHsFou-IyyjA.text: i live in new york part time, new york being "the land of the cheap and delicious sushi." after i moved back to pittsburgh, i was bummed to find that sushi places are few and far between. my friend suggested sawa, so i went along, and was very pleasantly surprised! the lunch menu is great (3 rolls for $11, plus soup and salad? yes please!) and the sushi itself was very tasty.  i'll definitely be going back!

uRuDsJmX7NfR2yqug3wkpA.text: when my co-workers suggested a hibachi place for dinner, my initial reaction to myself was "OH GOD! WHY WHY WHY?" i dont like hibachi. the food is bathed in butter and the whole show....cheesy. and we are in western PA, how good can the sushi/sashimi be? well....i was pleasantly surprised. the decor was nice, it was clean, and spacious. lucky for me we didnt sit in the hibachi section and we got seated right away and after reviewing their large menu we got the sushi, sashimi, and teriyaki dinners. the sashimi was great. good portions and good quality. the only thing that was annoying was the happy birthday song in a japanese accent? and disco lights that were coming from the hibachi section. but overall, the food is good here. and service is prompt.

J5kMVx_erUlFGBFabxF2nw.text: Well, surprisingly good hibachi place right here in Monroeville, located interestingly at the Mall.  I've been here a couple times and have tried the sushi, which is okay, but this place is all about the hibachi. I took a group of 5 here on Thursday for my sis' bday lunch.  The restaurant itself is the nicest Hibachi restaurant in terms of decor in my opinion in greater pittsburgh, despite its location (with maybe the exception of the bathroom, which looks like it should be located at the cleveland airport).  The space is very fresh with great earthtones and your customary asian images.  The seating for hibachi is pretty spreadout and the regular tables are big and comfy.  The lunch prices are reasonable for $9 you can get the chicken hibachi, with veggies, rice, sauce, salad.  You can also get a combo for $14.  The service is better than most places I've been and everyone there seems to be asian of some type and well trained unlike Nakama.  The food is fresh and the cooks are well trained.  They interact with you a little more than other hibachi joints, but they actually seem to enjoy it.  If you are in m'ville and want hibachi this is a much better option than shogun, one last thing they really make a big deal about birthdays, so if you really want to embarass someone on their bday this is the place to go.  They turn down all the lights, turn on a disco ball, have the whole restaurant staff gather round you while this super cheesy bday / disco song places in the background and the whole restaurant is encouraged to clap.  They also have this nice flower type candle for the bday girl to blow out and serve with french fried ice cream.  This is a good addition.

CptcsZum296lsIXws6RqnA.text: Not a bad place, but not great.  It is a good place if you don't want anything extra ordinary.  We had a good date night there.  We will go back.

M3BtQz6imhDeavxhoOFe1w.text: Ate here with a Groupon I purchased and I was still disappointed.  We chose to pass on the show at the Hibachi table in favor for a booth. We ordered a sushi and chicken entree and it was absolutely horrible.  I do believe that gas station sushi would have been better than that.  The only items that were semi tolerable was the soup and salad.    I have nothing nice to say for the service either.  The only time we saw our waitress was when she took our order, brought drinks ONE time, and then brought the check.  We told her that the food was terrible and asked to speak with the manager.  She mumbled something and never returned.  We waited 15mins for someone to come and never saw no one.  We just left the cash for the bill on the table and left.    Needless to say we ended up leaving this establishment  hungry and with $35 less dollars in our pocket (not including the price I paid for the Groupon).

C9Bh6P3d0Hbfm05sAgwdXg.text: I've been here countless times for the hibachi , normal dine in, and take out. The food here is superb, sushi is great and in a great size. Great decor inside. Comfortable waiting seats. The timing is not long, it's just about right. The hibachi is a unique experience from other places I've been. From my experience, the chef will interact more with people like tossing food to aim at your mouth, or squirting sake out of a toy child's mouth. If you're shy, it may feel uncomfortable cause they try to really include everybody at the table. Very unique. However, my only negative concerns is that the front staff occasionally doesn't understand English well, which is fine, but due to misunderstandings , has messed up our orders a few times. They do promptly understand however and will give you what you correctly ask for which is great service. Also I don't like that you have to be placed with other strangers at a table. I get that the tables and grills are limited but idk, other places I've been to have a table for each guests and nobody is all placed at one table. It can be awkward and I've had bad experiences where overly drunk people just ruin the experience. Definitely recommend though this place instead of the food court if you happen to be in monroeville mall.

awmMBfQhLIbZ6M67P6jzRw.text: This is where we go when we have large groups of people. You can't beat the large group atmosphere and the sake! The food (hibachi) the same as any other hibachi joint. Like the fact they started giving you low mein noodles with the dinners.   The Sushi is GREAT, i prefer the double spicy roll, or the dragon roll. But the saga roll is perfect for first timers to the world of sushi.   They have cut back on there sake selection, which bums me out, but is better for me the next morning.  *jedi certified *

lD0ufB1EFdRCMhBLCCl2pw.text: Meh.  You can do much better for Hibatchi and Sushi at Shogun or at the Waterfront. Salad dressing is crappy and salad had only iceberg and a half slice of cucumber.   Miso soups was a disappointment. No kombu. Very bland.  The veggie sushi platter was unimaginative and terrible. 2 avocado nigiri, 2 cuke nigiri, 3 yellow pickled unidentified nigiri, 3 brown pickled unidentified nigiri, and a roll with cuke and the two unidentified pickled veggies. No asparagus or carrot or anything interesting. No variation at all.  Hibatchi was also a miss.

NCMwHA63G_0FeHNb-0Vcaw.text: This is hands down the best Japanese Steakhouse in the area.  I love going here.  Been going since it opened, and I have never had a complaint about my meal.  I have ordered steak, chicken, and had the pleasure of trying friends and family's meals.  Never have I turned my nose up to any of it.  The sushi here is amazing.  Whenever it is my birthday this is the place I want to go.  When my friend and I have our college breaks and reunite, we do it here.  Last time we ordered $90 worth of sushi and ate all of it.    There is never a grain of rice left on a single plate when we are finished.  Always a great time, a great atmosphere, and a full stomach.    The only problem I have is I still cannot decide what sushi roll is my favorite because they are all so damn good.  Keep up the delicious work Saga.

GPJAJtOr9R3XXKOsNpsw_A.text: Nice decor. Sushi is not fresh and expensive for what it really is. Gets better than a 1 star for location and nice staff. I only ate take out sushi so rating based on that. I'm from the Hawaiian islands where sushi is abundant and this would be a 0 star there.

WahrM-xDvBU5mTywMRQzNA.text: At first I really liked this place, its pretty inexpensive I once bought 8 people dinner and drinks and was pleasntly surprised how cheap my bill was, but after eating yokoso its game over for saga.  compared to other places their sushi is subpar and their hibachi is just loaded with soy sauce.

-3Xs-e1Z1xUeg1xNgOLc8A.text: Good food excellent server, he was funny and helpful. My check was 45$ cheap, also I tip him 35$ so the total 80$ I forget his name but next time I go to saga I will request him to be my server.

gQasq36XjAq7RMkuWHPj-Q.text: Food and table service were great, possibly the best hibachi I have ever had!    However, I purchased a Groupon because I am a college student and was treated with the upmost disrespect and attitude. I have NEVER in my life been talked to with such disrespect especially from manager Kelly Mitchell and the hostess names Dawn. We were unable to use our Groupon because I purchased it that day and not the day before. When confronted on how the manger and hostess were treating us, they basically laughed in our face. What ever happened to the customer is always right?

1lmdmUqcBJZjHcWml9x_AA.text: Took forever to get a server and it was'nt even busy. Dressing had the consistency of snot and tasted worse. Ordered shrimp and scallop hibachi. The food looked and tasted like the chines food you get at the food court. If I wasn't so hungry I wouldn't have eaten any of it. Shogun and Yomato are far superior. Never again!

9ff-PBsX0QT9Z9iioG8x1Q.text: What can I say... I love Saga!  It's such a fun atmosphere with some of the best hibachi I've honestly ever had.  So, so, so cheesy (you have to love the birthday song coming on 20 times during your meal), but we always have a great night!  I've ordered both hibachi and sushi, and honestly it never disappoints.  The price is average for hibachi, and the chefs are (almost) always a blast - we only had one guy who was pretty awkward, but I think that was due to the rude people at our table who should've just ordered takeout if they were going to be so cranky.

lSO9wU50JJ8DUFZtpX6ylQ.text: Super birthday dinner! Went with a very large groups, and I think this is the key to a great meal at SAGA.   Great food,  great service, excellent hibachi chef.  Spike was his name???   More sake, more sexy.  I recommend this place highly

jBL1UO92y-lW4BUmQ6AY_g.text: where do I start, waitress does not listen too my order, I ask for for no vegetable in my fried rice I get plenty. I order the chicken no flavor what so ever. try cooking food with flavor, I recommend you go up the hill too shogun

qZW3GYC6iECMV3mEWn9Rjg.text: Sawa (now Saga) is another chinese-run hibachi/sushi combo places, that try to be entertaining.  While it may not be amazing, still beats most of the other places around the area.  Been here a few times, and a couple of things stick out: 1. that annoying chinese waiter/host guy with glasses who treats customers rudely and thinks he's funnier than he actually is 2. cool dinner seating (non-hibachi side) which you sort of climb-into, kinda feels like getting into those canoes you rent at the lake 3. the ridiculously fobby happy birthday song accompanied by a cheesy light show   Sushi was decent when I tried it, it was above average quality for the area.  (the deep fried Sawa roll is actually good)  For Hibachi, I was pleased -- mainly since the chef asked to add less soy sauce into the fried rice (since I was with a Chinese party), and overall the meat was not as salty as some other hibachi I've had.  Filet was good, but I recommend against the chicken.  I also sampled the salmon teriyaki - but the sauce was pretty unappetizing.   One might want to be wary of the "no wait" promise for Hibachi, which included 20 minutes of waiting area and 10-15 minutes before we got our chef.  Slightly annoying since our party included a 1 month old and also a 98 year old :)

Z4g-NcuniuBMZ43yrjTXaA.text: I tried their new location in Cranberry PA off of Route 19. The decor and aesthetically speaking it is done very nicely, lots of interesting light fixtures and glass work. However the food leave a lot to be desired. I order the California roll and the spicy California roll, the only difference was the spicy had a blob of sauce on top, not mixed in with the crab like a True sushi place does. Also I ordered the combination box, with steak and shrimp. The steak had all the fat left on it and there was 3 shrimp, they try to make it up with the plate being filled with half right, veggies and noodles. The salad was the same as all, and the miso soup was relatively cold when it was brought out, also very clear and not much taste. Like I mentioned it was new, but a decent lunch crowd, however wouldn't go back.

y3D1d52XW8dQ4mVMaVWiIA.text: Rating is only on the Hibachi table dining experience:   - Servings were smaller than some of the other hibachi places.  It seems every time we go to one of these restaurants, the veggie and meat portions get smaller.  - The chef was more entertaining than some of the other restaurants, although each of the 'surprises' are more predictable at every single place. It has a WOW factor if you've never been to one of these hibachi restaurants. So, how about changing it up guys?   - Not sure if I like the fact that the chef used the same utensils on beef, chicken and shrimp without wiping off his utensils at all.   - Best Value:  If you were having a birthday celebration (and I am only referring to those old enough to consume alcohol) then this might be a very entertaining placed to have that birthday bash. Gather about 10 people to sit around your table.  Then "Get Ready, Set.....Open your mouth!" The chef will take his sake in a squeeze bottle and squeeze it into your mouth from about 3 feet away while saying, "More Sake, More Handsome" and "More Sake, more babies" and other sayings.   All observed from a neighboring table. But then our chef asked our table if we wanted some, also. Only one couple participated. But as he was leaving, he made sure to stop at the party table to offer sake a la squeeze bottle too. All we could say was that we hoped the party had a designated driver with the amount squeezed into their mouths.    - Clean restrooms were a plus.  Recommendation:  Good for parties and that first time WOW factor if you've never been to a hibachi steakhouse.

UHv-kZHMw13mKjnWlYRbQA.text: Saga is an awesome restaurant! We were going to another sushi restaurant down the road for the past 5 years. This place opened about a year or two ago and it has officially hit our #1 sushi restaurant for the past year. My husband hates to go to sushi that gives you small rolls. Sushi isnt cheap so you want your $$ worth. The sushi here is great with nice portions. This past weekend we went and there was an issue with a coupon that we had. I talked to Cassie and told her that they are our favorite sushi restaurant and she was able to satisfy the situation. So another great job Saga! Keep up the great work!!!!

jPnegppdjj_5o7tdz9VXGQ.text: Good food and show. Sushi tastes great and they have a choice of sake. Not the cheapest place, but worth it a few times a year.

XxiEEIB5TwARW0aKmfZupA.text: Best sushi for the drive from New Alexandria.  It is awesome!  The service is very friendly.  They have the special tables that feel like you are sitting on the ground, too.  It is a hibachi grill, too, but I'm all about the sushi!

2a_eqOA-KGjELRHpXfgrdg.text: I was a bit skeptical after reading some of the reviews. Glad I didn't listen -- I was pleasantly surprised. We were greeted enthusiastically. The waiter was attentive. The food was delicious! I had shrimp hibachi and my husband had chicken hibachi. The rice was especially good, very tasty. Used a groupon so it was well with the $13 for the $25 value. We will be back!

6yi9N8uyFiLc9KGPKdgodA.text: The food is always delicious the atmosphere is phenomenal And the severs are very kind i recommend if you're hungry for hibachi and entertainment!

m21-k3h5RcYdE5lKJMCwhw.text: Went here tonight for Hibachi. The service was good and the chefs show was also good. The food not so much. It was extremely undercooked and bland. Ended up getting really sick a few hours after. Defiantly would not recommend this place to anyone!

6QFwrGhDJjOp_wfi5rlqGw.text: Strike 2 Pittsburgh. This place is ridiculous. It's amazing to me that it's more difficult to find a gas station or grocery store that sells a 6 pack of ultra light beer in this state than it is to find terrible sashimi/sushi.  For those who aren't aware of the difference: sashimi is the fish in it's purest form. The best Japanese restaurants take pride in serving only top quality sashimi grade fish. Sushi is the fish you find either wrapped inside a sleeping bag of rice or placed sophisticatedly atop a bed of rice. Both require a better than average skill to make in excellent qualities and/or portions. Sushi/sashimi is an art form.  This is the 2nd "Japanese" restaurant I've visited in the area and I'm beginning to think a good quality Japanese restaurant just doesn't exist here.  Everything looked like it had been laying around for several hours. My sashimi platter was less than adequate and I didn't even want to finish it for fear of becoming ill.  The spicy salmon roll, which I don't normally order but was feeling frisky for, again looked like it had been made 3 hours ago and was served to me as if it were just made. Even my wasabi (which I LOVE) had a brownish tint as if it too had been sitting in the open air absorbing particles only God knows about.  My sake, while it came out nice and hot, was not the usual Gezekkan sake I'm accustomed to, and therefore by no fault of the restaurant for not having the brand I prefer, was just the icing on top of this nicely decorated but poor quality cake.  I'm sorry to those who have found this restaurant amazing for creating such a poor review but I'm writing to those who are avid sushi fans; you know who you are. The ones who venture outside of the California rolls, the dragon rolls, and the Philly rolls; I'm speaking to you. Steer clear.

photos.caption: Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Regular sashimi platter. Again, looked and felt like it had been sitting uncovered.
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Spicy salmon roll which fell apart promptly at the touch of a fake wooden chopstick.

aTbka0si_Pz9Q7OdS6SuSQ.text: Without question, THE BEST sushi I have EVER had!! The hubs and I stopped in for dinner a couple nights ago, and we ordered 3 rolls to share, and each one was amazing! We usually like one more than another,  or maybe don't quite care for one.. but this night, we loved all 3. We ordered the Saga Monster Roll, the Rocking Volcano and the Phoenix.. and they were so so good! Our service was good, as well. One thing I love about getting sushi is that you can typically get in and out pretty quick, and this was no exception. We were seated immediately, served promptly, and of course, loved our food!

sdiN068iW19dsWG88GiDiA.text: Nice place for Hibachi, fresh food, quite environment. Its a nice resturant for fun time with friends.

Wec0QmJD3-dr83RdBnGXeg.text: Great service at the bar and awesome food. highly recommend! Probably the best sushi i've ever had in Pittsburgh

cB1CYTOymq_igMpgxlTt0Q.text: Be careful with your Groupns, our party of 6 was limited to use of only 2 Groupons.  Had we billed our checks as parties of 2, we could have used 3 Groupons.  Not happy.  Staff had no clue as to what "gluten free" means.  Manager came over after the soup and salad was served, indicating the salad dressing and sauces were NOT gluten free.  Mind you, I asked several times prior.

YlaupuSH1pv-UHLBOe1x8w.text: Not impressed with food quality or taste. Just not what I'm used to with a moderately priced hibachi restaurant. The spicy roll entree that my husband ordered was absolutely disgusting. Minced fish mixed with spicy sauce was a gross consistency. My hibachi steak was tender and flavorful but the rice and overcooked noodles were nasty. Got suckered by a Groupon, would rather pay full price for a good meal...

Oi8NYEUiH_Jx7w_4xhM3fQ.text: Folks, I am here to tell you that I was impressed with this place!  It is not everyday a mall sushi joint gets this kind of praise!  A customer picked this sushi joint out and when we pulled up, I was like "oh boy, this should be interesting"  Getting past the mall issue, the restaurant is nicely decorated in the usual oriental stuff.  Friendly staff and very clean.  Nice sushi bar with a very large plasma flat screen.  Now for what rocked me.  The sushi was terrific, fresh and the presentation was awesome.  I cannot tell you the last time I tapped out of a sushi meal.  But these rolls were large, like large to the point, some at my table actually had to cut them in half.  I on the other hand shoved it all in my mouth :-).  The nigiri was like a fillet!  LoL, normally Unagi, Tuna, Salmon are bite size, well people, these cuts were fillet size, friggin large as hell.  I ate so much that I was kind of ill......  Note:  this is a good thing.  A couple of us had the hibachi, which was excellent too.    To bad, I do not visit Pittsburgh all that often, I could get used to eating at Saga!!!!!

koEsTFFhC3E0Y7UOAG4ySg.text: Not impressed. I typically give restaurants the benefit of the doubt, however, after 2 lousy experiences, as my boyfriend said, "this place sucks." Apparently Saga is Japanese for lukewarm. The first time we went was because we had a Groupon. Apparently 2, $15 sushi rolls is not considered a dinner. Which if you want to play the fine print card, then fair game. So we went back, this time being sure to order 2 "dinners." Both times my boyfriends tea was barely warm and the salad was drenched in water. Our food arrived fairly fast, however it wasn't until our food arrived that our waitress asked us which kind of rice we wanted. By the time we had finished our entrees, which were half cold, our rice was still not at our table. When we asked our waitress about it she said, "I'm sorry, but my chefs don't speak English, so it's really hard to get them to make the rice." WHAT?! Needless to say, we will not be returning.

dsqa43ZS53UNXqIMkgusVg.text: I have eaten here twice, the first time was good, loved the seaweed salad and how they add the cucumber to the bottom.    The second time we ate there the service was the worst! we we're seated and then sat for 25 minutes before they came back and asked for our drink orders.    We then waited another 25 minutes for our sushi orders, we noticed that the rise was still warm which had heated up the sushi, and I would like to ask everyone that reads this...  Have you EVER ordered a spicy tuna roll and when it was served the tuna was ground, like hamburger?   I for one have never.   When I asked why the tuna was ground up and what the crunchy balls were, almost like uncooked tapioca beads, and why the rice and sushi was warm, the hostess told me "I DON'T THINK YOU HAVE HAD SUSHI BEFORE."    We paid our 60.00$ bill for the food we could not eat and will never go back again.

pMGITpGQhDbN0BRutHSgTQ.text: Feeling somewhat nauseous as I write this.  Very mediocre sushi rolls, horrible ginger salad, and poor service.  And believe it or not, they only have the green sodium-free soy sauce in bottles!  The sushi isn't even worth it at 50% off.  Keeping my fingers crossed that it's just an upset stomach

KH6N7An9W-vYZhXPgP3LxQ.text: The filet minion at the hibachi table is to die for. It's absolutely delicious. The meat is so tender and then they cook it right in front of you. It tastes so good. Also the vegetables are so good!!

tH2pzVqPLNbPHCVQrzNt2w.text: I have been here on multiple occasions. The food is very good and the prices are good for the hibachi places I've been to. My biggest problem is the cleanliness.   Everytime I've gone there to sit at a hibachi grill, it was clearly not cleaned. If it was, it was a gentle wipe at best. There is leftover food from previous meals fried to a crisp and sometimes sludge in the corners from cleaning the liquids at the end. Keep in mind, I've been to four or five hibachi places and have been to two of those five ten+ times; my favorite I go sometimes multiple times monthly. My point being I know how the grill should be cleaned and look. Here it's just not up to par and I don't like my food getting mixed with old burnt up rice from God knows when. Due to that cleanliness problem, I rate it a two.   It's a nice place, the decor is great and besides the very hard to understand waitresses the real problem is the cleanliness. Fix that up and I'll be back more often.

9igNkUGyQT0LWpA9VA4P2w.text: Terrible. Bad service. There was a cockroach on...thats on top of the hibachi statiom next to us as people were fonishing their meal and paying up they smashed it with the server book and then made a scene. We were halfway yhrough our meal so finished eatong because at that point there was nothing we could do. The server then rang in and charged us for the wrong drink and when he fixed it he gauranteed that it would not be  charged twice but it did go through twice. When i called to complain and get our money back i demanded he refund the entire order and he said that because he wasnt there that day theres nothing that he could do about it. I will never go back and i dont think that any one should eat there ever again.

0QTPZ44yCju2SVnJUZzIIg.text: Saga can suit any sort of craving you have.    First, the sushi.  I've stopped in at both lunch and dinner hours.  The chefs are quick, the servings are large and its all reasonably priced (compared to say, Nakama.) My favorite is their rainbow roll, but do try their daily specials. Everything is amazingly fresh!   Second, the hibachi.  Nothing incredibly special about the presentation or food, but all combinations are fairly priced and tasty.  My personal favorite is a hibachi staple, the steak and shrimp.  After Saga hibachi, I always leave full and happy, if with a slight case of indigestion.   Lastly, the Japanese "dinners." They have several cook-to-order meals and appetizers. Their gyoza (dumplings) are some of the best I've ever had, and definitely try their noodle dishes if you haven't.  Service is (almost always) quick and friendly.  I docket them a star for a few times when service was EXTREMELY slow in the front table area.   Otherwise, it's a great place for Japanese food despite its mall location.

wutGzfMxP54dKBOKzT-msg.text: We came to Saga before going to the movies at the mall.  It was a Saturday but it was very easy to find a table (not sure if this is good or bad :)). Our hibachi chef was very entertaining and joked with us, making the whole experience better.  The rest of the waiting stuff was also on top of things and very helpful.  The food was tasty, even though I am not the biggest fan of asian flavors (and this is why I only gave it 3 stars) and I also did not order anything elaborate.  Hence, people with similar attitude  with me can try the place; I feel they will not be disappointed. Particularly the sauces that accompany the hibachi are very good! I got the chicken hibachi, while I also tried the beef and they were both good.  If I around the mall I will not bring any objection in visiting the place again.

QS0Od56Xkx5gVtKEyWiVLw.text: The worst sushi we've ever had. I'd even venture to say that the "sushi" available at Chinese buffets exceeds this sushi in quality. We were extremely disappointed in the maki. Too much rice and a strange filler of imitation crab and mayonnaise? The fish seems low quality. If this is someone's idea of great sushi, I feel very sad.

ZPcuugR8r1tROcUU14RHeA.text: We had a surprise birthday party for my sister-in-law.  A wonderful time was had by all.  The chef's put on an amazing show for us. Food was fantastic. The wait staff were warm and friendly.  The food was delicious.  The manager, Cassie, was professional and genuinely invested in the party being a success.  I would highly recommend Saga Monroeville for any party or just a fun place to go for dinner.

LGI6TY2WepqLA1NhihzKtA.text: Came here during my first few months of moving to Pittsburgh and the experience was pretty underwhelming. I bought a Groupon and still had to pay quite a bit over the Groupon price. The food tasted like standard Hibachi fare but the performing chef was either tired or annoyed (or both) and did not seem in a good mood to cook for the table at all. Nothing special, high prices and portions were kind of small. We took some fried rice home but the entrees were on the skimpy side. It's been 3 years since I've been there and I will probably never go for their hibachi again. I hear they have sushi specials on Monday nights though.

GTJf-7YHjlX6FbvjGMpA7Q.text: I've never not had a good time here! I've been several times with just another friend or two, at a booth. The servers weren't the most personable but they were attentive enough and really, we were there for the food.... which is delish!   I've only ever had various sushi rolls and fried rice while there and it's never disappointed!   Once we had a large group at a hibachi table sans the hibachi. Our server was organized and able to accommodate all of our separate checks and separate meal types (hibachi, sushi, etc). It was so much fun! And again, every single person was happy with their meals.   Atmosphere is great too... not too casual but not uppity either. I'd feel comfortable going in there after running errands or still in my work clothes.   Love this place!

GUJY7jnq97cdlT6Hhkx7Ww.text: This is an interesting restaurant.  You can sit on the hibachi side (where you sit through the chef's "show" of cooking your food and being cliche with the onion volcano, or you can sit on the other side of the restaurant near the bar/sushi bar and have a more intimate and quiet experience.  The booths look like they are about to call apart.  There are throw pillows on them to cover the holes.  The waitress said they are replacing the booths "soon" but they said that the last time I was in the restaurant about two months ago.  The hibachi side is loud and you will be seated with strangers.  The other side is a bit quieter but isn't overly appealing.  The menu has several pages of options.  Appetizers, sushi and sashimi, hibachi dishes (you can order hibachi entrees on the non hibachi side) and other entrees.  I've had sushi, hibachi and non hibachi entrees here.  Most have been decent, but not extremely memorable.  They do have great presentation, though.  Most entrees come with a small salad and miso soup.  Neither are overly exciting but are a nice start if you are hungry.    Servers are friendly, but they often have a very limited understanding of english, so it can be a challenge if you have questions about the menu or a request that isn't standard.    Watch for Groupon or Living Social deals as they often have them and you can basically get half off.  Overall it was enjoyable, but not my favorite hibachi experience in the Pittsburgh.

7Al-6l5sLIIjnRy-BXt7nw.text: Fun place to take kids.. Or a friend u really don't like.. But u feed them with a long spoon  lol but naw kewl... Place check it out my yelpers

photos.caption: Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Dim sum
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Pomegranate wine martini
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Shrimp and scallops

Ud9jBeiv2dP8XcxvNqsyGg.text: We were seated fine, salad soup came out in normal time.  After 45 minutes no chef we begin to ask, as we see that tables seated after us are already receiving their meals.  Yes, they have a chef and us none.  They gave our chef to another table seated after us and completely forgot us.  When we finally get a chef he rushes to cook our food without proper seating and totally leaves one of the party with no fried rice.  We also realize that during this time our waitress had avoided our table as I am sure she didn't want to bring their screw up to our attention!  The manager's response is to offer us more drinks or desert.  We explain that we won't be able to eat more, and already have had enough to drink and yet tries to bring us more drinks.  Now I am not about to accept a DUI and more alcohol over poor service! The other family with us is completely ignored till the end.  Both the lady from the other family and my wife approach the manager that a discount should be offered.  His response is a smug look, no and a threat to call the police!  I am sure he could care less as they may have the traffic to remain open, however for a Friday night there was little to no wait and they were half full as it was.  Avoid at all costs and go to Yamato better service and food!

vLQ19lFaa69ST6XOgNPDHA.text: I just went to Saga for take out and think I was given the smallest maki roll I've ever seen for $12.  It was like a gas station sushi. Terrible!!! I feel like I was ripped off.   I typically get hibachi to go and it is very good. I can't stand the thought of giving them more money after paying $18 for a such a small roll and 3 spring rolls.

photos.caption: Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States

816Rjw2Q09C48CwiGZ03mQ.text: If I could give this place no stars I would. I am not a negative person, but this restaurant I am sorry is horrible. Being a prior restaurant owner and in the field for years, I know that customer satisfaction should be above all else. They have never met or exceeded expectations. I have tried to give the benefit of the doubt as I have done with other places. The hibachi is okay at best. I have had it twice. The front waiter restaurant service is horrible. They are not friendly nor do they offer an attempt at good service. I have never had a good experience, either the food wasn't cooked properly, the food was cold or lacked flavor or taste. It is never crowded when I have gone, and see no reason for the service to be as poor as it is. The sushi was never wrapped tight enough and fell apart with the chop stick. The soup has been cold or luke warm at best.  The tea lacks taste all together. I am sure others have had a great experience and enjoy the place. I do not recommend this place nor will I return. My recommendation would be Yoko's in the Waterfront in Homestead.

Rvm1Ah1Pw3KqnQsl-NmYzg.text: We stopped in here for a family dinner about a week ago. I'm sure everyone is aware that you have the option of having the chef do some fun cooking in front of you. I have 3 girls and they were all fired up about watching him. Yes, I played the seal when he tossed food in the air and caught it in my mouth. Who said i don't have talent. ;)  Ok, my wife and I both went with the steak and shrimp. You get the rice, noodles, and veggies all cooked in front of you. The chef and server were great with the kids for you parents. They did the volcano of fire from sliced onions. They tossed me food, i performed. As a heads up a kids meal is $12 so keep that in mind. Either way,the service was great and they were on top of everything. A fun time for a date or a family function.

photos.caption: Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Steak and Shrimp feast. :)
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Crab Rangoon&#39;s, very good but not needed w all the food
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Soup and salad with the entree.

orOq94XfoX2rONo8G46eKg.text: Clean and nice atmosphere. I ordered the Saga Monster Roll and it was absolutely delicious. Reasonably priced, not too expensive. The service was just okay, the waiter wasn't extremely friendly but everything came out quickly. I will definitely go back for more sushi.

photos.caption: Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Saga Monster Roll

zuPl_XHZwFR9UV6XEzxR0g.text: Great food at the hibachi grill. I always get the steak and shrimp with fried rice, sushi side and a warm sake. A little pricey but fun to watch and really hits the spot. Decor is a little cheesy in the main dining area.

kZ1Re0GeF_JuNW3V7Jlc7Q.text: Been to this place before, the experience was usually ok, but recently we went there for lunch and asked for a tempura. What was served was 4 pcs of shrimp sauteed in soy sauce. We complained that it's not tempura, and the waitress who could barely speak english claimed that it's tempura. We were disgusted, we paid a lot of money for a lunch serving with very little food. Won't come back again.

BubW5vk-kvDhaOIG62gQUA.text: Our group of 3 were staying at the hotel across the street and were planning on eating at a different restaurant until we realized it was in the food court. Lucky for us! We all enjoyed a variety of apps, sushi and the Hibachi and everything was great. I travel quite a bit for business and this was one of the better experiences I've had in a while.

75dX4byQ1LPhqwUYW7Z0Bg.text: Had my first Hibachi experience last night here. Amazing food!! We had an amazing chef! And Amazing Manager!! The only thing we weren't happy with was our server! She forgot to order our appetizer , she didn't understand 95% of what we said and I was late to sit down at the table and she stood over me rushing me to order food and beverage! I told her it was my first time there and she didn't understand she basically picked my dinner for me cuz she didn't understand I needed a few minutes to look at the menu! And she messed up people's checks at the end she was a hot mess!! Everyone else was really really friendly and we had a great time celebrating our friends birthday there! Deff will be back in the future!!! Hopefully soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States

9ClcakH-uCmSyiuknvVi9w.text: A succinct review...  The good: The hibachi chefs are friendly.  The bad: The decor was dark and old The sushi was poor quality; the spicy salmon and spicy tuna were notably low grade The salad was unappetizing, and the dressing tasted worse The soup was bland  Took over 30 minutes for the chef to arrive, even though there was only 1 other table of guests.  The wait staff don't speak English well enough to properly serve a restaurant; I asked for regular soy sauce, instead of the 2 bottles of low sodium soy sauce, and it took 2 different people before I was understood  I've been here twice, and my second visit was my worst experience at a hibachi steakhouse. I advised the manager and the hostess that I had to leave in 45 minutes. Either they didn't understand or care, because I left without even the shrimp appetizer being prepared. There are much better places in Pittsburgh to get hibachi. Unfortunately, if you live near Monroeville, you'll just have to drive a bit to get to them.

Ck2WACZL-Yre0DOcucpdbQ.text: I have to be honest, went here 3 times in one week while on travel. This was a awesome place, great food, service and entertainment. Great happy hour all day Monday specials too!

XiV3fHj1Iy5mmlC0UJ7arw.text: Saga is a good place to hangout and also their service and food is good. I am a loyal and repeating customer with zero complaints.

pqbKWHBWTj8CegSeHcEf5A.text: Refused to take a Saga gift card when their location was listed on the back of it! Won't be going back anytime soon.  Food was good, but nothing special.

Nso0q1BNSaQZYy8mngSemw.text: Definitely go here for lunch! Their lunch specials are such great deals I wouldn't even think of dining for dinner.  Their sushi is super good and they have a really good bar area. I've never sat at the hibachi tables, always to the right side of the building when you walk in but I've always had good food. They do carry out too which is good so you can order and pick it up, and the service is pretty fast!

83J3eWIg7titFqhB91Twyg.text: The quality was very good but the portion size went way down hill. 3 people tonight 92.00 I got 6 pieces of shrimp and barley any chicken usually I take food home but nothing left tonight not even rice. And I was very disappointed to see them serving sake to a minor we even brought it to the chefs attention but he just didn't understand us.. they better watch themselves..

pw1PuspqPtyKgFxqBhzKhQ.text: Warning: this review is going to be unsettling.  The food was typical hibachi food which I think is always delicious. The chef was great. Service was friendly and prompt. We saw the menu said auto gratuity for parties of four or more. We were five. So we asked. Then the waiter made a motion with his hand, waving it over his face and said, "no that's just for black people."  !!!!  What!!!!!!  !?  That's all.

hlecoqNycaCST8VcRdhB3w.text: After seeing the large billboard advertising this place for MONTHS, we finally decided to give it a try.   We came specifically for their 50% off sushi on Monday's after 4pm. Knowing this deal, our bar was set fairly low. Mall sushi, and discounted.   However, the food surpassed expectations!   Upon walking in, we were immediately greeted by the bartender (who was located right next to the host stand). The place is a stand-alone restauraunt, not necessarily 'in' the mall itself. It has a nice aesthetic, and the hibachi is separated from those eating sushi. We were taken to an area with booths, and although the seating was limited on this side, we were seated immediately and did not feel crowded.   We ordered a lot: a spicy tuna roll, the valentine roll, a spicy salmon roll, and regular roll,  and an order of crab rangoons (which were not discounted). In addition to a daquiri, our total bill was ~$42  That's a steal!  The food came out SO fast, and was delicious! We will absolutely be coming back on Monday's because the deal is too good to pass, for such good sushi!

l_EFd31YAH9RQpj9VavemA.text: We were visiting the area for a reunion and wanted to get some good sushi. The food was excellent. The quality of the dishes and the taste were just really great. We were seated promptly and once we ordered our food was delivered quickly. The service itself was just OK. We were left hanging for a while after we ordered the appetizers, but overall we were pleased with our visit. We were just mentioning that if we had this restaurant in our home town we would visit it often.

lmjJGRk1NGik9yOdLol_kQ.text: I love this place! They have great food. Watching the hibachi chefs work their magic was fun! It makes for a great night!

XKw3nvS3IRc-guTam5OvGQ.text: Have been here a good bit of times and can verify that it has always been a pleasant experience . I've sat at the bar, hibachi table and their booths - all wonderful. Food is delicious , service is great and specials are AWESOME. Happy hour , half off sushi days , Groupon deals - no reason not to come here. Bartenders are always friendly and inviting . Can't leave without a saki bomb !

photos.caption: Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Sake Bomb !
Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States

iwKok2QZXPXVk1__ATpvMg.text: I really enjoyed my food with my children here. The sushi was Amazing. The hibachi cook was funny and, was very entertaining.

YUahITCshD-Gluqbsmyh9w.text: This was a random date lunch I went on and our chef was hilarious. Not only did we enjoy his show and chef skills we loved the yummy food.   Lunch specials are great but if you want left overs then go ahead and order that dinner meal, especially when you are throwing combinations hibachi into the picture.   Since it was earlier in the day the waiter wasn't as attentive but it was still good being there.

tvvT-PAMv5UgJ9Lp_fVp5Q.text: This is always a nice place to stop when in the monroeville area. They are friendly and offer a good range of dishes. Their bar is convenient and clean. I would recommend this spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States. Crab rangoons and sake bombs

s4m2IY4X7xVgAP6mAUpvqw.text: People can say what they want regarding eating sushi at a mall, but this place never disappoints. they make great sushi, it's made in a timely manner, it's very reasonably priced, and I rank it among the best in the city of Pittsburgh.  I've never gotten a bad meal from this place not one time. The hibachi meals are also very good but I'm a big sushi guy and I have to say that this is my go-to spot either here in Monroeville or at their Robinson location.  The sweetheart roll, the pink lady, and the Saga roll are among my favorites.

BjCjQqRvUB6YuYGjhRbZtA.text: How do you mess up a patron's evening out with his son, and your business?  1. Fail to train your staff to take an order correctly.  2. Fail to check on the table until it's too late to  fix it, so they're stuck with the incorrect order.  3. When the server comes by and is told of the problem, don't apologize. Say "I can still get what you're missing" even though the customer - my son - is basically done eating. It's too late. 4. When the manager breezes by to check on the table, he should chuckle and smile about the issue, then again offer the missing items, though the meal is done. Offer it as take out. We didn't come to the restaurant for take out, but toss it out there anyway. Then, ask the customer to tell you how to make it right, because that's the now angry customer's job...to fix your screwup. 5. Never address the kid whose order was goofed up. Never actually say something like "Young man, I am sorry your food was incorrect. It was our fault and there is no excuse for it.". 6. Act like giving the customer a 10% discount fixes it. Guess what - not even close. Saga Hibachi... you'll close soon, I bet, just like the rest of that old mall. We've patronized your restaurant plenty of times, and you used to do a lot better. You have gone downhill, if our visit....our last visit...is any indication.

8_hgDl0EcFD0WIr0DKhrXw.text: Terrible service. Manager rude, arrogant and does not know anything about customer service. Service took forever and the food was not good. Got salad and a wine,  then waited an hour after that for a chef to come out!! Then, he didn't have enough food for the table. The people who came in after us requested a special chef, which was the one we should've gotten so, unfortunately..we got skipped. What? They came in 20 minutes AFTER us.  If they have a special request, they should have waited- not our table who was there first!?!

tQeewKOrOANMa6TOPWhm8A.text: Watch out for thieves here!  Somehow our credit card was stolen before our bill could be paid. The card DISAPPEARED between our table and the cc machine.  Manager would not let us look at cameras but claimed he watched them and saw nothing. Needless to say, we cancelled that cc immediately and reported it stolen there.

o74aVNe2Mhw8jCGmDe8sQg.text: The food was good, as it is always at any Saga. I was meeting with a friend I hadn't seen in three years. Big reunion. I drove an hour from Monaca to meet him for dinner. He wanted sushi, I wanted hibachi. The host didn't seem to understand so my friend said "I'll get hibachi too" and we were escorted to the hibachi side. I was fine with it initially as it looked like we would be alone. After we finished our soup and salad they brought four teenage girls to our table who then took their time ordering. I was asking my friend if we could move to our own table and the waiter overheard us. He told us to tell the chef. We asked the chef who urged us to stay and told us we could move once the food was done. He cooked then left and we weren't sure what to do so we reluctantly ate next to the girls who were taking photos of their food/being typical annoying teen girls and at one point were talking to some guy on speaker phone. We told both the waiter and the chef that we would prefer to be at a private table and were not allowed to move.  Not a good experience.

XPm0Xaesfmxpfu7CzAZ2gg.text: Omg! This food was so delicious, so amazing, no lie I was closing my eyes in pleasure enjoying the moment. The prices are affordable, especially the lunch specials. I shared a exotic Blue Hawaiian drink with my husband and it was perfect. The chef was great and fun. Went here for my husband's birthday yesterday and we really enjoyed it. Was not crowded, only one other couple at the table with us. Waiter and chef did not take long to get food started or to wait on us. Our 2 little ones were with us and of course they didn't want what we were eating so we stopped at fast food beforehand and they let the kids bring their food in with them. Amazing staff and great atmosphere. Restaurant was also clean.

Z3AIsSQklfU-j1I5LeeJwg.text: Got hibachi and some sushi! Sushi was just OK but the hibachi was really good! The cook was really sweet and the portions were good size. Our service was a little slow but I think she was just busy! I would recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Saga Hibachi Steakhouse & Sushi Bar - Monroeville, PA, United States

UQ1O6LHIOtY5c-wHGhFtsg.text: This review is old, but worth a read.  I eat Sushi and Edemame all the time.  Seafood here is slimy, smells.  Steak is not identifiable as steak.  Edemame wilted, soft slimy.  I have not been here in three years, only come here for bottled beer, because I assume that is at least safe.

LM7CpaUebjDXUhO9Gx0ctA.text: Not even sure where I should start with this review...  We made reservations for 7:oo pm on a Monday evening for a party of 13. The restaurant was bare...that should have been my first clue!  Our server was unfriendly and should not be working in the service industry. He barley spoke 3 words to us the entire dinner.  I had to ask him for a glass of water 4 times (and 20 minutes later) before he finally remembered to bring it.  We ordered sushi and it was delivered without soy sauce or chop sticks. Again I had to ask for soy sauce 3 times before he remembered.  I had to get up and go to the bar for refills on our drinks because our waiter was MIA. When I mentioned to the bartender how dissatisfied I was with the service he said he would tell his manager. Typically the manager would then come to the table... but not this place. The owner could have cared less and just blew me off when I brought it up to him. His response was "Yeah, Yeah I fire him tomorrow" and brushed me away with his hand. This is not acceptable and you do not speak to a paying customer like this.   Then comes paying the bill... The owner of this place ran my friends PNC credit card through the machine so many times that PNC actually called her while we were trying to pay. He was swiping the card instead of inserting the chip into the card reader and she was being charged every time he swiped the card. They put a hold on her card and she had no other form of payment so... what does the owner do??? He calls the Monroeville Police Department. She had no other form of payment so we offered to pay her check with our card and he actually refused!  Another sign of a poor establishment...when you see %18 gratuity will be added to parties of 4 or more printed on the menu. If you need to add gratuity to parties of 4 or more you must be doing something wrong.  Upon leaving the kids noticed there were fish in a pond by the door.  There was barley any water in the pond and the water that was in there was absolutely filthy. I am beginning to wonder if this is the fish they use for the sushi??  This place is overpriced, dirty and the portion size is small. If you want good service and good food at a reasonable price then you need to visit Edo Hibachi behind Westmoreland Mall...and kids eat free every Sunday.

zscgUEIczPXgMoCP74Aegg.text: Tonight will be my LAST and FINAL time eating at this Saga Japanese Steak House restaurant. We arrived prior to closing time at 10:15pm, and restaurant doesn't close until 11:00pm Friday's. We were served cold soup, and immediately after are hibachi chef served our food we were bombarded with checks. We were given inadequate time to eat and they were very RUDE and IMPATIENT when asking for boxes, to go sauces, etc. The manager seemed very bother by our presence and when asked for to go sauces he threw them on the opposite side of the table and asked rudely "is there anything else".  They even began cutting off lights and told us to hurry up and RUSHED us along, and continued to stare at us as we were trying to enjoy our food. We were followed to the door by the manager, and the manager and his staff refused to respond when we spoke to them telling them thank you and have a great night.

_8fST6Oy2dta43DL6_7o_g.text: The worst service was here today. One server and one cook. Took them 30 minutes to bring me drinks. I won't be back.

85KFpKgU88n2Eu8LctCTEw.text: From the outside this place doesn't look too exciting or nice, but don't be fooled! I first went here my graduation dinner, and the staff happily seated us around the table with another family. We went here again for another family outing. Hibachi can be expensive, but the lunch prices are certainly reasonable. The menu consists of several options. Each time we've gone here, we've never had to wait more than 10 minutes to be seated. I just love the hibachi experience, and Saga certainly does it well. The soup is delicious; I don't care too much for the salad dressing but hey to each his/her own!

o_vFvNlY2tgzjKH0dtvxJg.text: Service is very friendly and warm. Unfortunately, food takes a little bit longer than average, and the quality is the equivalent of grocery stores.  That being said, the size of rolls is more often than not small as well, which doesn't add up with the price they ask. I would come here for their 50% off deal on mondays after 4!
